text: Democrats are conspiring to reelect Trump
author: BradWarthen

text: Well, we certainly did! We got home last night. As we landed in Philadelphia my wife looked out the window and said, “It’s not very green...” I’m glad you enjoyed the posts!
author: BradWarthen

text: Yes, there ARE! When the president does something major, you tell him it’s a BFD. Also, you’re over NASA. That’s essential. We have to ramp up our space travel capabilities for when the Vogons come to demolish Earth for a space bypass...
author: BradWarthen

text: As we await the sun, our driver Pat says “We call this a soft mornin’” Damp, dark, a bit misty. “It’s why we get so rusty...”
author: BradWarthen

text: Encountered this lady in a walled garden on the castle grounds. Demeter, I’m thinking, a.k.a. Ceres?
author: BradWarthen

text: This is where we’re staying tonight. But don’t be envious: The greens of the adjoining golf course haven’t been mowed since 1362. But I didn’t bring clubs anyway, so it’s all good...
author: BradWarthen

text: It’s hard to find photography shops in the States in the age of the iPhone. But I keep seeing them in Ireland. I wonder what it is that makes them still viable here...
author: BradWarthen

text: Know your potatoes! A hardware store window in Tullamore...
author: BradWarthen

text: Odd marketing ploy: Hey, at least our food is better than starving!
author: BradWarthen

text: I keep thinking: Imagine belong forced by overwhelming circumstances, such as famine, to leave this gorgeous land for the squalor of the poorer quarters of 19th-century Boston or New York...
author: BradWarthen

text: A relatively rare sight in Ireland (the parts that be seen, anyway): a tilled field. Most of what you see is green pasture...
author: BradWarthen

text: They have one horrible incident, and they go ahead and deal with the problem. Amazing... “New Zealand to Ban Military-Style Semiautomatic Guns, Jacinda Ardern Says,” via @nytimes
author: BradWarthen

text: As I say, the water REALLY moves here in Galway...
author: BradWarthen

text: Knocking about Galway on the (alleged) first day of spring. The water REALLY moves in these rivers...
author: BradWarthen

text: I think my wife has discovered a nondescript booby. Or something... @BryanCaskey @MikeFittsat140
author: BradWarthen

text: Too late! We’re in Galway now...
author: BradWarthen

text: The thing to do, as the bus whizzes past the scenery, is to press the phone against the glass (to minimize glare) and press the button multiple times, quick as you can. You MIGHT get something... or not...
author: BradWarthen

text: Rainbow... but no sign of a leprechaun, much less a pot of gold...
author: BradWarthen

text: I suppose there’s ONE thing as bad as that, if not worse...
author: BradWarthen

text: Just met the biggest optimist in Ireland (not a lot of competition for that title, mind you). He told us, as we approached the edge of the Cliffs of Moher, that he thought the mist was clearing and we might be able to see something. Some of my very best shots...
author: BradWarthen

text: Remember the hilarious episode of “The IT Crowd” in which Roy and Moss couldn’t go because of the presence of a “toilet guy?” Well, in Roy’s native land, I found something even MORE inhibiting...
author: BradWarthen

text: I KNEW there couldn’t be that many medieval towers standing in one country! At the cliffs of Moher, we caught a crew of builders apparently putting one up in the mist, the sneaky beggars!
author: BradWarthen

text: The closer we get to the western Irish coast, the mistier it gets. Not sure we’ll be able to see those cliffs...
author: BradWarthen

text: The thing about a slate roof is, it’s HEAVY...
author: BradWarthen

text: So... his “reason” is a particularly lame, partisan “what about?” Pulling in something completely unrelated (that is, unrelated except for the Wikileaks connection)? How pathetic...
author: BradWarthen

text: And now we’re in the Locke pub with some traditional Irish music and dancing...
author: BradWarthen

text: Been in Limerick several hours and no one has yet demanded that I write a dirty poem with a particular rhyme scheme. So, there’s that...
author: BradWarthen

text: Paused for lunch in Adare. Known for its thatched cottages. Ate at Pat Collins’ Bar. Irish stew, chips and a Rockshore...
author: BradWarthen

text: He’s a professional. I think...
author: BradWarthen

text: On the road to Limerick. Pics taken from the bus aren’t great, but I’m constantly reminded that the ENTIRE COUNTRY is essentially a picture postcard. It’s not affected for tourists. It’s just Ireland....
author: BradWarthen

text: A lady asks as we ride through the park, where are the birds? Driver: “We’re after eatin’ all of dem...” I didn’t kiss the Blarney Stone, but someone did..
author: BradWarthen

text: The driver on our carriage ride in Killarney points out a small upright  stone. Says it’s a leprechaun tombstone. Run over after “too much Guinness.” He’s joking: “There’s no such t’ing as too much Guinness...”
author: BradWarthen

text: What folks are having to think about in Ireland...
author: BradWarthen

text: Is it all right to have English mustard on a traditional Irish dish? Apparently so. This is always among the condiments on the table...
author: BradWarthen

text: This guy and his goat sit by the road in Sneem on the Ring of Kerry, being picturesque...
author: BradWarthen

text: More from the Ring of Kerry...
author: BradWarthen

text: Some views on the Ring of Kerry...
author: BradWarthen

text: A brief stop on the Ring of Kerry to shoot a wild romantic vista. Finally got a closeup of the gorse we keep whizzing past...
author: BradWarthen

text: I’d been wanting to find a shebeen, but I went into this one and never a tint did they offer. In fact, the people were a bit stiff. But Irish coffee was available in the gift shop for €6...
author: BradWarthen

text: When we saw the prehistoric bog man in the museum back in Dublin, I thought of the delicate question with which Mark Twain and friends would bedevil their guides in Innocents Abroad: “Is... is he dead?” http://twain.lib.virginia.edu/innocent/text/inn27.html …
author: BradWarthen

text: As soon as we pulled up to the place, for the first time on the trip, Holmes seemed uneasy...
author: BradWarthen

text: I’m in big-headed guy heaven. I don’t think I’ve EVER seen a display like this in the States...
author: BradWarthen

text: I still read the paper in the mornings, over breakfast. And when I read, I tweet...
author: BradWarthen

text: Just realized my videos of the Killarney St. Patrick’s Day parade aren’t going through. Switching to still photos...
author: BradWarthen

text: This Killarney kid is NOT enjoying his first St. Patrick’s Day parade...
author: BradWarthen

text: Blarney Castle....
author: BradWarthen

text: And of course there’s the sheep, everywhere...
author: BradWarthen

text: Surprised to see snow on the mountains this morning...
author: BradWarthen

text: And it’s a bright, shining St. Patrick’s Day in the south of Ireland. On the way to Blarney Castle...
author: BradWarthen

text: This one, in fact. From dinner last night...
author: BradWarthen

text: Getting on the coach to leave Waterford, everyone tells me the deck clerk was looking for me over a bar bill. So I go in and pay so the Garda won’t chase me across Ireland. Over one Guinness. €5.20.
author: BradWarthen

text: Kathleen Parker: “Beto O’Rourke’s 2020 campaign is a youthful folly”
author: BradWarthen

text: Not that Gordon minded. But others did, I took it...
author: BradWarthen

text: The Irish are a most hospitable folk. They made me my own special Irish coffee. Because the cream would kill me. #allergies
author: BradWarthen

text: Well, I denied it, of course. But Gordon Hirsch said, “Doesn’t matter what you say...”
author: BradWarthen

text: One thing about Ireland, they’re VERY generous with the potatoes. This is how many I had left tonight when I could eat no more. MAYBE I have enough Guinness left to wash down ONE more...
author: BradWarthen

text: I love the sign in this Kilkenny barbershop window...
author: BradWarthen

text: Marching band from North Dakota parading through Kilkenny...
author: BradWarthen

text: Sorry about the two “actuallies.” #everybodyneedsaneditor
author: BradWarthen

text: Actually, she may have been the ONLY one who actually welcomed me. I was told most of the newsroom saw me as the “Knight Ridder spy”...
author: BradWarthen

text: She was the first person to welcome me my first day at The State. She was 23...
author: BradWarthen

text: All the kids in the city seemed to skip school for the protest...
author: BradWarthen
